controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program provide for verification of KYC information by reliable and independent electronic data?
Does your AML/CTF program include risk-based systems and controls to assess whether electronic data is reliable and independent?
controls.detail-label: Describe your systems and controls for assessing reliability and independence

controls.label: Does your assessment of electronic data evaluate the accuracy of the data?
controls.detail-label: Explain how you assess data accuracy

controls.label: Does your assessment of electronic data evaluate how secure the data is?
controls.detail-label: Explain how you assess data security

controls.label: Does your assessment of electronic data evaluate how the data is kept up-to-date?
controls.detail-label: Explain how you assess data currency and maintenance procedures

controls.label: Does your assessment of electronic data evaluate how comprehensive the data is (including range of persons covered and collection period)?
controls.detail-label: Explain how you assess data comprehensiveness

controls.label: Does your assessment of electronic data verify whether the data has been obtained from a reliable and independent source?
controls.detail-label: Explain how you verify source reliability and independence

controls.label: Does your assessment of electronic data determine whether the data is maintained by a government body or pursuant to legislation?
controls.detail-label: List the government-maintained or legislatively-mandated data sources used

controls.label: Does your assessment of electronic data consider whether the electronic data can be additionally authenticated?
controls.detail-label: Explain what additional authentication methods are available

controls.label: Has your AML/CTF program pre-identified which reliable and independent electronic data sources it will use for verification?
controls.detail-label: List the electronic data sources you will use for verification

controls.label: Has your AML/CTF program established pre-defined tolerance levels for matches and errors in electronic verification?
controls.detail-label: Document your pre-defined tolerance levels for matches and errors

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program define whether and how to independently confirm KYC information by initiating contact with the person the customer claims to be?
controls.detail-label: Describe your independent contact procedures and decision criteria

groups.title: Electronic Verification Scope
groups.description: Determines whether your AML/CTF program uses reliable and independent electronic data to verify KYC information.

groups.title: Electronic Data Reliability Assessment
groups.description: Risk-based assessment of whether electronic data sources are reliable and independent, based on accuracy, security, currency, comprehensiveness, source verification, legislative basis, and authentication capability.

groups.title: Selection of Electronic Data Sources
groups.description: Pre-identification of which reliable and independent electronic data sources your reporting entity will use for KYC verification.

groups.title: Match and Error Tolerance Levels
groups.description: Establishment of pre-defined tolerance levels for matches and errors in electronic verification results.

groups.title: Independent Contact Verification
groups.description: Procedures for independently confirming KYC information by directly contacting the person the customer claims to be, where appropriate.
